title: Man's proposal lasts seven days - but people are only looking at engagement ring
text:

There's proposals, there's extravagant proposals, and then there's this.

When Dhar Mann decided to pop the question to his travel blogger girlfriend Laura G, he came up with a seven-day plan she, and the internet, would never forget.

To put it into perspective, day one involved giving her a new home - that's the level of completely-out-of-our-league proposal we're talking about here.

Filming the whole thing to upload to YouTube , the influencer said: "I wanted to have a proposal that she would always remember, that even when she was much older she could look back and smile with those memories.

(Image: laurag_143/Instagram)

"So I put together a seven-day scavenger hunt that started in LA and ended in Paris.

"It's not easy getting anything past Laura so I knew she knew I was going to propose soon but she didn't know how I was going to do it, where I was going to do it or exactly which moment.

"So to keep her on her toes I kept each day full of surprises and completely different from the next."

After walking Laura into her a new home on day one, Dhar then went to her parents to ask permission, knowing that family is one of the most important things in Laura's life.

(Image: laurag_143/Instagram)

The next two days involved surprising Laura, her sister and her mum with a spa day, before she returned home to a party with all of her closest friends, and 'spoiling her' with a shopping trip to Beverly Hills.

No influencer Instagram proposal would be complete without a trip to Disneyland, so they headed to see Mickey before Dhar flew them both to Paris.

Day six involved a hotel room covered in rose petals before the grand finale featuring a private terrace, the Eiffel Tower and violinists. Yep.

"For the actual proposal I wanted it to be really special," said Dhar. "I decided to do it in Paris because it's one of her favourite places in the world.

(Image: laurag_143/Instagram)

"I decided to rent a private terrace that overlooks the Eiffel Tower. My plan was to blindfold her and then walk out to this amazing view.

"Right as the blindfold would come off, I'd have violinists playing her favourite song.

"I'd walk her down a path that would be covered in long stem white candles on both sides and with the Eiffel Tower as the backdrop, I'd get down on one knee and propose."

Despite the rain (maybe the private terrace should have had a roof made from caviar), Laura happily agreed to become Dhar's 'forever'.

After uploading photos every step of the way, the couple's millions of followers couldn't get over the sheer size of the ring.

One wrote: "Holy shhh! You're finger is gunna fall off!"

Another said: "How can you even hold your hand up, that thing looks heavy AF!"

Welcome to proposals in 2019. Good luck.
description: The week-long adventure started in LA and ended in Paris, but it was the size of the ring that stole the show
